params.name: info
params.doc: List of marketing consent information to update or create.

docs.summary:
Creates or updates multiple marketing consents.

Note that `info.lastConfirmationActivity` is required unless the `state` is `REVOKED` or `NEVER_CONFIRMED`.

docs.summary: Retrieves a marketing consent by its details.

examples.title: Get a marketing consent by its communication details

permissions.name: Read Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to view marketing consents.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of marketing consents, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting. Up to 100 marketing consents can be returned per request.

The default `sort` is `id` in `ASC` order. For a detailed list of supported operations, see [filtering and sorting for marketing consent properties](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/marketing-consent/sort-and-filter). To learn how to query marketing consents, see [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).

examples.title: Query Marketing Consent

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

docs.summary:
Removes a marketing consent by its communication details.

Removing a marketing consent cancels the consent, and updates the `state` to `REVOKED`. The marketing consent still exists, but the subject of the marketing consent is no longer eligible to receive commmunication. To delete a marketing consent entirely, use [Delete Marketing Consent](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/marketing-consent/delete-marketing-consent).

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

params.name: mask
params.doc: Explicit list of fields to update

docs.summary:
Updates a marketing consent's properties. 

Only fields provided in `mask.paths` are updated. You can update the following fields:

+ `state`
+ `lastConfirmationActivity` 
+ `extendedFields`

Each time the marketing consent is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

permissions.name: Manage Marketing Consents
permissions.description: Request permission to manage marketing consents.

params.name: marketingConsent
params.doc: Marketing consent to create or update.

docs.summary:
Creates or updates a marketing consent.

Note that `marketingConsent.lastConfirmationActivity` is required unless the `state` is `REVOKED` or `NEVER_CONFIRMED`.

members.doc:
Expected `wix.marketing.marketing_consent.v1.marketing_consent`.
Fully Qualified Domain Name.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
Expected `updated`.
Event name.

members.name: updatedEvent
members.doc: Event Info

members.name: entityId
members.doc: MarketingConsent ID associated with this event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data as key:object pairs. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields. 
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were created.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type struct

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data as key:object pairs. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields. 
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were created.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

members.name: id
members.doc: Marketing consent ID.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number.

members.name: details
members.doc: Marketing consent communication details.

members.name: state
members.doc:
Marketing consent state.
Default: `CONFIRMED`.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the marketing consent was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the marketing consent was updated.

members.name: lastConfirmationActivity
members.doc: Last confirmation activity of the marketing consent.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Additional fields.

members.name: type
members.doc: The communication channel of the marketing consent.

members.name: identifier
members.doc:
Supported values:
+ `email`: Email address used for the marketing consent.
+ `phone`: Phone number used for the marketing consent.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address used for the marketing consent.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number used for the marketing consent.

members.name: source
members.doc: Source of the given consent (how the visitor signed up).

members.name: description
members.doc: Consent description.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the consent was updated.

members.name: optInLevel
members.doc: Consent opt in level, either single or double confirmation.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
 If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
 If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

messages.name: _wix_marketing_v1_MarketingConsentDetailsIdentifierType
messages.displayName: Marketing Consent Details Identifier Type Object

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_TYPE
  • EMAIL
  • PHONE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATE
  • NEVER_CONFIRMED
  • REVOKED
  • PENDING
  • CONFIRMED

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_OPT_IN_LEVEL
  • SINGLE_CONFIRMATION
  • DOUBLE_CONFIRMATION

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SOURCE
  • IN_PERSON
  • FORM
  • LINK_CONFIRMATION
  • EMAIL_SERVICE
  • OTHER

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_LINK_TYPE
  • CONFIRMATION
  • REVOKE_CONFIRMATION
